home.alcomDescription: A fast and open-source VRChat Creator Companion alternative
home.cliDescription: A fast and open-source command line client of the VRChat Package Manager

alcom.hero:
A fast open-source alternative of VRChat Creator Companion (VCC)
ALCOM is a cross-platform application available on Windows, macOS, and Linux.

fastInstallation.title: No more long waiting for package installation
fastInstallation.content: You don't need to wait for tens of seconds to install each package anymore. You can install multiple packages at once, and upgrading packages would take only a few seconds in most cases.

accessToChangelog.title: Quick access to the changelog
accessToChangelog.content: You don't need to search for the website to see what's changed in the new version. When the package specifies, ALCOM shows quick access to CHANGELOG on installing packages.

usableWithVCC.title: Can be used with VCC
usableWithVCC.content:
You can use ALCOM and VCC together. You don't have to uninstall VCC to use ALCOM.

Nothing to do migrating from VCC to ALCOM.

Except for bug on the VCC*, changes in VCC would affect ALCOM immediately, and vice versa.

* The bug VCC ignores & restores changes to settings.json would ignore changes in ALCOM to settings.json like adding repositories.

fullName.question: What does ALCOM stand for?
fullName.answer: ALCOM is the complete name of the application, not an acronym.

nameOrigin.question: Where did the word ALCOM come from?
nameOrigin.answer:
ALCOM was originally derived from the term ALternative (VRChat Creator) COMpanion.
However, alternative companion isn't the name of this tool; it's a description of its purpose.

vrcGetRelationship.question: What's the relationship with vrc-get-gui and vrc-get?
vrcGetRelationship.answer:
ALCOM is a graphical user interface designed for managing VRChat packages.
It's built on top of the open-source command-line tool vrc-get.
Previously known as vrc-get-gui, ALCOM offers a more user-friendly way to install, update, and manage VRChat assets.

migrationFromVCC.question: What's needed to migrate from VCC?
migrationFromVCC.answer:
Nothing is needed. ALCOM loads, uses, and writes shared settings as VCC where needed.
You also don't need to uninstall VCC to use ALCOM. ALCOM manages to not conflict with VCC.

cli.hero: A fast and open-source command line client of the VRChat Package Manager

winget.title: Using WinGet
winget.content: If you're using modern versions of Windows 10 or 11, you can install vrc-get with WinGet.

scoop.title: Using Scoop
scoop.content: If you're using Scoop, you can install vrc-get from xrtools Bucket.

aur.title: Using PKGBUILD from AUR
aur.content:
If you're using Arch Linux, you can install vrc-get with PKGBUILD from Arch User Repository.
We are using yay in the following commands, but you can use your favorite AUR helpers.

cargoBinstall.title: Using Cargo Binstall
cargoBinstall.content:
Cargo Binstall will download & install prebuilt vrc-get from GitHub.
For more details, please see Cargo Binstall.
